FeedItems.Title: Augment Reality with Xamarin and iOS 11
FeedItems.Summary:
One of the showcase features of iOS 11 is ARKit, an augmented-reality mode available on devices powered by A9 and newer chips (basically, 6S and better iPhones, 2017 iPads, and iPad Pros). With ARKit, users hold up the device and view a composite of the video feed and computer-generated imagery (either 2D SpriteKit or 3D […]

The post Augment Reality with Xamarin and iOS 11 appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Learn How The Lean Cook Uses Mobile to Drive Revenue and Promote Healthy Living
FeedItems.Summary:
The Lean Cook, a popular UK diet and fitness blog started as a hobby by a husband and wife team, is a prime example of how to design apps for the user. Instead of simply replicating web content on a smaller screen, the team crafted an interactive shopping and cooking experience. They’ve grown a loyal following, and their latest project (available […]

The post Learn How The Lean Cook Uses Mobile to Drive Revenue and Promote Healthy Living appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Xamarin.Forms: Tips for Beating the Learning Curve
FeedItems.Summary:
As a first time user learning any new technology or pattern, there’s always a curve, and over the years I’ve stood at the threshold of a product and gazed up that curve to determine how painfully steep it appeared and how long it would take until I was productive. Now, as the Program Manager for Xamarin.Forms, […]

The post Xamarin.Forms: Tips for Beating the Learning Curve appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Xamarin All-Stars at .NET Conf 2017!
FeedItems.Summary:
Join Xamarin Product Managers and Engineers at .NET Conf 2017, a free virtual event for any developer. This year’s speaker line-up consists of all-star Xamarin speakers, including Miguel de Icaza, James Montemagno, and Mikayla Hutchinson, who will present on Xamarin tooling and the latest on what’s happening with Xamarin and related technologies. What’s .NET Conf? […]

The post Xamarin All-Stars at .NET Conf 2017! appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Get Your Apps Ready for iOS 11!
FeedItems.Summary:
We’ve just updated our iOS 11 support to go along with the Xcode 9 GM Seed release. You can use this build along with the Xcode 9 GM to submit applications that take advantage of the new features in iOS 11, tvOS 11 and watchOS 4 to the Apple AppStore. We also have awesome new sample […]

The post Get Your Apps Ready for iOS 11! appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Xamarin.Android 8.0 Gets Even Sweeter with Oreo
FeedItems.Summary:
Android 8.0 Oreo is by far the sweetest version of Android to date, with great new features including notification channels, notification badges, custom fonts in XML, downloadable fonts, instant apps, background limits, autofill, and picture-in-picture (PIP). We’re excited to announce Xamarin.Android support for Android Oreo in our latest release of Xamarin.Android for both Visual Studio […]

The post Xamarin.Android 8.0 Gets Even Sweeter with Oreo appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Podcast: Android Oreo Support, Xamarin Live Player Preview 2, New iOS 11 Previews, and more!
FeedItems.Summary:
In this episode of the Xamarin Podcast, James Montemagno and I discuss all of the amazing new previews available to Xamarin developers, including Android Oreo, iOS 11, Xamarin Live Player, Xamarin.Forms, and more! We also discuss some exciting news with the Xamarin MVP Program and a new certification level for Xamarin developers. Be sure to […]

The post Podcast: Android Oreo Support, Xamarin Live Player Preview 2, New iOS 11 Previews, and more! appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Digitally Imported Delivers 10 Music Streaming Apps to Millions of Fans Globally
FeedItems.Summary:
One of the first music streaming services and the #1 radio network for electronic music fans, Digitally Imported’s laser focus on UX and mobile quality helps them retain their competitive edge and keep users coming back for more. The team has grown from one developer and one app to a global team supporting five (near […]

The post Digitally Imported Delivers 10 Music Streaming Apps to Millions of Fans Globally appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Live Webinar | Xamarin University Presents: Exploring UrhoSharp 3D with Xamarin Workbooks
FeedItems.Summary:
Join me on Thursday, September 21 at 9 am PST for my upcoming webinar on using UrhoSharp 3D with Xamarin Workbooks, which combines what I like most: graphics programming and helping developers build better apps.   Register   I love how graphics programming allows you to visualize something in your mind, and then see it […]

The post Live Webinar | Xamarin University Presents: Exploring UrhoSharp 3D with Xamarin Workbooks appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Explore iOS 11 Previews Today
FeedItems.Summary:
Since the announcement of iOS 11 at WWDC, we’ve been working on providing the new APIs as web previews with Xamarin.iOS from our releases blog. To help you get started building apps with the new iOS 11 APIs, we’ve put together an Introduction to iOS 11 guide covering new features in iOS 11. We’ll regularly […]

The post Explore iOS 11 Previews Today appeared first on Xamarin Blog.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Bump to lipzip/rel-1-3-0/51ff59da (#863)" (#874) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The new version fixes CVE-2017-12858 and CVE-2017-14107.

**PR notes**
The original PR failed to build on Windows, its follow up failed as well - despite passing the correct (or so it seemed) `CMake` flags, static library was still being built. This, hopefully, fixes the issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Updated reference to mono/mono@bf21d1a" (#878) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: fixes 59274... not sure this applies to XA, but it would be good to build with the same version as is used for XI and XM

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Updated reference to mono/mono@bf21d1a" (#878) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "[libzip-windows] use libzip.dll and zlib.dll from NuGet" (#877) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
When bumping libzip in #874 or #863 libzip is no longer building under
mxe. We can switch to using the NuGet packages instead.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[linker] port #59015 fix to XA" (#875) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Make sure the methods required by the debugger are not linked out. Fixes #59516.

Note that this commit doesn't fix the assert reported in #59015 on
Android as it happens with linker turned off as well. So that will
need another fix.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Fix $(EmbedAssembliesIntoApk)" (#876) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Commit 73dc058 removed the default for `$(EmbedAssembliesIntoApk)` if
it is blank. This was not the right thing to do :).

This commit adds the a default of 'True' is `$(EmbedAssembliesIntoApk)`
if completely emplty by the time it has gone through all the other
processes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Fix $(EmbedAssembliesIntoApk)" (#876) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Commit 73dc058 removed the default for `$(EmbedAssembliesIntoApk)` if
it is blank. This was not the right thing to do :).

This commit adds the a default of 'True' is `$(EmbedAssembliesIntoApk)`
if completely emplty by the time it has gone through all the other
processes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[linker] port #59015 fix to XA" (#875) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Make sure the methods required by the debugger are not linked out.

Note that this commit doesn't fix the assert reported in #59015 on
Android as it happens with linker turned off as well. So that will
need another fix.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[tests] `gradlew` needs JAVA_HOME set on Windows" (#870) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Closed pull request "Fix MXE build of libzip" (#868) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Commit https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/fa9f62a113bf9fba42e39c4556b130988137b967 failed to update the MXE build of the library
and so it was still being built as a static archive (which is the
new libzip default) and caused build failures when building
libzip executables.

This commit makes MXE build a shared version of the library and,
hopefully, fixes the issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump to lipzip/rel-1-3-0/51ff59da (#863)" (#874) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The new version fixes CVE-2017-12858 and CVE-2017-14107.

**PR notes**
The original PR failed to build on Windows, its follow up failed as well - despite passing the correct (or so it seemed) `CMake` flags, static library was still being built. This, hopefully, fixes the issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Android] Use bitwise ops on caching strategy in ListViewAdapter.cs" (#1149) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Expect all ListViewCachingStrategy tests to use bitwise operations after changing `ListViewCachingStrategy` enum to a flag. Actually, while trying to carve Android work out of the iOS work I cut too deeply and missed a few callsites in `ListViewAdapter.cs`. 

Continuation of #1143.
